users_app.models module¶

class users_app.models.AbstractUserProfile(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: Model

An abstract base model for user profiles with common attributes.

Attributes:

TYPE: Defines the profile type, should be specified in subclasses. user: The user associated with the profile. created_at: The timestamp when the profile was created. file: A file associated with the profile, stored in FileUpload.

class Meta¶

Bases: object

abstract = False¶
TYPE = None¶
created_at¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

file¶

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a one-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Restaurant(Model):
    place = OneToOneField(Place, related_name='restaurant')

Restaurant.place is a ForwardOneToOneDescriptor instance.

class users_app.models.BusinessProfile(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: AbstractUserProfile

A profile model for businesses, extending AbstractUserProfile, with additional business-specific fields.

Attributes:

TYPE: The type of profile, set to ‘business’. user: The user associated with this business profile. location: The location of the business. description: A description of the business. working_hours: The business’s working hours. tel: The business’s contact phone number.

objects = <django.db.models.manager.Manager object>¶
offers¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

order_set¶

users_app.tests module¶

class users_app.tests.AuthTests(methodName='runTest')¶

Bases: APITestCase

Tests for user authentication endpoints, including login and registration.

Attributes:

AUTH_DATA (dict): Test data for registration including username, password, and email.

AUTH_DATA = {'email': 'new@email.com', 'password': 'newPassw0rd', 'repeated_password': 'newPassw0rd', 'type': 'customer', 'username': 'newuser'}¶
setUp()¶

Calls the general setup for shared test data.

test_login_false_password_bad_request()¶

Tests login with incorrect password.

Asserts:

400 Bad Request status.

test_login_ok()¶

Tests successful login with correct credentials.

Asserts:

200 OK status. Presence of required fields in response data.

test_registration_email_missing_bad_request()¶

Tests registration with missing email field.

Asserts:

400 Bad Request status.

test_registration_email_taken_bad_request()¶

Tests registration when email is already taken.

Asserts:

400 Bad Request status.

test_registration_ok()¶

Tests successful user registration.

Asserts:

201 Created status. Valid customer profile association. Presence of required fields in response data.

test_registration_passwords_not_matching_bad_request()¶

Tests registration when passwords do not match.

Asserts:

400 Bad Request status.

test_registration_username_taken_bad_request()¶

Tests registration when username is already taken.

Asserts:

400 Bad Request status.

test_registration_weak_password_bad_request()¶

Tests registration with a weak password.

Asserts:

400 Bad Request status.

class users_app.tests.General(methodName='runTest')¶

Bases: APITestCase

Base test setup class for creating test users, profiles, and tokens.

setUp()¶

Creates a customer and business user, with associated profiles and authentication tokens.

class users_app.tests.ProfileTests(methodName='runTest')¶

Bases: APITestCase

Tests for profile-related endpoints, including retrieval and updates.

setUp()¶

Calls the general setup for shared test data.

test_get_business_profile_list_ok()¶

Tests retrieval of business profile list.

Asserts:

200 OK status.

test_get_customer_profile_list_ok()¶

Tests retrieval of customer profile list.

Asserts:

200 OK status.

test_get_profile_detail_business_ok()¶

Tests retrieval of business profile details.

Asserts:

200 OK status. Expected profile data matches response.

test_get_profile_detail_customer_ok()¶

Tests retrieval of customer profile details.

Asserts:

200 OK status. Expected profile data matches response.

test_get_profile_detail_user_not_found()¶

Tests profile retrieval for non-existent user.

Asserts:

404 Not Found status.

test_get_profile_detail_user_profile_not_found()¶

Tests profile retrieval for user without a profile.

Asserts:

404 Not Found status.

test_patch_business_profile_detail_ok()¶

Tests updating a business profile.

Asserts:

200 OK status. Expected updated profile data matches response.

test_patch_customer_profile_detail_ok()¶

Tests updating a customer profile.

Asserts:

200 OK status. Expected updated profile data matches response.
